720332f-a.title: Manhattan: Harlem River Drive - Dyckman Street
720332f-a.text:
(1)
Harlem River Driveway, east side, slightly south of Dyckman Street
(where it comrences), showing the entrance and narrow approach to the
Manhattan PPatrol Life Saving Service, at the Harlem River. Across the
river (background) appears the Wew 3ork Dniversity Buildings, which
are in the Bronx.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A detail of the same, (not seen in view 1), showing the boat house
of the Manhattan Patrol Life Saving Service on the river. (fhis boat
house is obstructed from sight in view 1, by the passageway and a
wooden shed).
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720332f-a.folder: Harlem River Drive & Dyckman Street, Manhattan, NY

719379f-a.title: Manhattan: Dyckman Street - 10th Avenue
719379f-a.text:
Dyckman Street, south side, east from but not including Tenth Ave.,
showing a portion of Highbridge Park. From the point where the street
makes a sharp bend southward (left) is the Harlem River Driveway running
along the western shore of the Harlem River. In the distant background is
visible the University Heights section of the Bronx.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720332f-b.text:
(1)
Harlem River Driveway, east side, slightly south of Dyckman Street

(2)
A detail of the same, (not seen in view 1), showing the boat house

720332f-b.folder: Harlem River Drive & Dyckman Street, Manhattan, NY

720333f-a.title: Manhattan: Harlem River Drive - Dyckman Street
720333f-a.text:
Harlem River Driveway, east side, slightly south of Dyckman Street
(where it commences), showing the entrance to the Lone Star Boat Club
on the Harlem River. In the background is discernible the west shore of
the borough of the Bronx.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720333f-a.folder: Harlem River Drive & Dyckman Street, Manhattan, NY

719380f.title: Manhattan: Dyckman Street - Fort George Avenue
719380f.folder: Dyckman Street & Fort George Avenue, Manhattan, NY

719378f-a.title: Manhattan: Dyckman Street - 10th Avenue
719378f-a.text:
Dyckman Street, west from Tenth Ave., showing (left) a portion of
Highbridge Park and (background) the Seventh Ave.-Van Cortlandt Park
Line of the I.R.T. subway running at this point on an elevated structure
on Nagle Ave.
April 20, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720335f-a.title: Manhattan: Harlem River Drive - Dyckman Street
720335f-a.text:
Harlem Piver Speedway, at the northern point where it bends westward
to become Dyckman Street. This view taken during the bicycle days illustrats
the mode of dress of that date.
About 1897.
Ewing Calloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720335f-a.folder: Harlem River Drive & Dyckman Street, Manhattan, NY
